body:
Hello @gfyoung! Thanks for submitting the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/io/excel.py`](https://github.com/gfyoung/pandas/blob/13abef88b59ded1f7ad58d8ae5600b724c7f99b5/pandas/io/excel.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/io/test_excel.py`](https://github.com/gfyoung/pandas/blob/13abef88b59ded1f7ad58d8ae5600b724c7f99b5/pandas/tests/io/test_excel.py) !

That's what I was hoping :) +1

On Tue, Nov 13, 2018 at 8:00 AM gfyoung <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@gfyoung* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In pandas/io/excel.py
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23661#discussion_r233047516>:
>
> > @@ -634,14 +634,17 @@ def _parse_cell(cell_contents, cell_typ):
>                  else:
>                      offset = 1 + max(header)
>
> -                for col in index_col:
> -                    last = data[offset][col]
> -
> -                    for row in range(offset + 1, len(data)):
> -                        if data[row][col] == '' or data[row][col] is None:
> -                            data[row][col] = last
> -                        else:
> -                            last = data[row][col]
> +                # Check if we have an empty dataset
> +                # before trying to collect data.
> +                if offset < len(data):
>
> What are the changes to the excel file?
>
> To add a test that addresses your question:
>
> Do we have a test where offset is equal to len(data)?
>
> Don't worry, I accounted for the off-by-one ðŸ˜‰
